intro: Homalium breviracemosum, commonly known as the short-branched holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, typical of the Rubiaceae family. It is often found in humid, lowland forests and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
